io.spine.server.storage

Class RecordStorage<I>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.server.storage.AbstractStorage<I,io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord,RecordReadRequest<I>>
      • io.spine.server.storage.RecordStorage<I>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - the type of entity IDs
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Storage<I,io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord,RecordReadRequest<I>>, StorageWithLifecycleFlags<I,io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord,RecordReadRequest<I>>, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    InMemoryRecordStorage, ProjectionStorage

    public abstract class RecordStorage<I>
extends AbstractStorage<I,io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord,RecordReadRequest<I>>
implements StorageWithLifecycleFlags<I,io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord,RecordReadRequest<I>>
    A storage keeping messages with identity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecordStorage

        protected RecordStorage(boolean multitenant)
        Creates an instance of RecordStorage which does not support the EntityColumnCache.

        This creation method should only be used for the RecordStorage descendants, that are containers for another RecordStorage instance, which actually supports EntityColumnCache, for example, a ProjectionStorage.

        Instances created by this constructor should override RecordStorage.entityColumnCache() method.

      • RecordStorage

        protected RecordStorage(boolean multitenant,
                        java.lang.Class<? extends Entity> entityClass)
        Creates an instance of RecordStorage which supports the EntityColumnCache.

      • write

        public void write(I id,
                  EntityRecordWithColumns record)
        Writes a record and its entity columns into the storage.

        Rewrites it if a record with this ID already exists in the storage.

        Parameters:

        record - a record to store
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the storage is closed

      • readMultiple

        public java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord> readMultiple(java.lang.Iterable<I> ids)
        Reads the active records with the given IDs from the storage.

        The size of the returned Iterator matches the size of the given IDs Iterable.

        In case there is no record for a particular ID, null will be present in the result. In this way readMultiple() callers are able to track the absence of a certain element by comparing the input IDs and resulting Iterable.

        E.g. readMultiple(Lists.newArrayList(idPresentInStorage, idNonPresentInStorage, idPresentForInactiveEntity)) will return an Iterable with three elements, first of which is non-null and the other two are null.

        Parameters:
        ids - IDs of record of interest
        Returns:
        an Iterator of nullable messages

      • readMultiple

        public java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord> readMultiple(java.lang.Iterable<I> ids,
                                                                            com.google.protobuf.FieldMask fieldMask)
        Reads multiple active items from the storage and apply FieldMask to the results.

        The size of the returned Iterator matches the size of the given ids, with nulls in place of missing or inactive entities.

        Parameters:
        ids - the IDs of the items to read
        fieldMask - the mask to apply
        Returns:
        the items with the given IDs and with the given FieldMask applied

      • readAll

        public java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord> readAll()
        Reads all the active records from the storage.
        Returns:
        the Iterator containing the ID - record entries.

      • readAll

        public java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord> readAll(com.google.protobuf.FieldMask fieldMask)
        Reads all active items from the storage and apply FieldMask to each of the results.
        Parameters:
        fieldMask - the FieldMask to apply
        Returns:
        all items from this repository with the given FieldMask applied

      • readAll

        public java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord> readAll(EntityQuery<I> query,
                                                                       com.google.protobuf.FieldMask fieldMask)
        Reads all the records matching the given EntityQuery and applies the given FieldMask to the resulting record states.

        By default, the entities supporting lifecycle will be returned only if they are active. To get inactive entities, the lifecycle attribute must be set to the provided query.

        Parameters:
        query - the query to execute
        fieldMask - the fields to retrieve
        Returns:
        the matching records mapped upon their IDs

      • readAll

        public java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord> readAll(EntityQuery<I> query)
        Reads all the records matching the given EntityQuery and applies the given FieldMask to the resulting record states.

        By default, if the query does not specify the LifecycleFlags, but the entity supports them, all the resulting records are active. Otherwise the records obey the constraints provided by the query.

        Parameters:
        query - the query to execute
        Returns:
        the matching records mapped upon their IDs

      • readRecord

        protected abstract java.util.Optional<io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord> readRecord(I id)
        Reads a record from the storage by the passed ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the record to load
        Returns:
        a record instance or null if there is no record with this ID

      • readMultipleRecords

        protected abstract java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord> readMultipleRecords(java.lang.Iterable<I> ids)
        Obtains an iterator for reading multiple records by IDs.

        The size of the returned Iterator matches the size of the given ids, with nulls in place of missing or inactive entities.

        See Also:

        Obtains an iterator for reading multiple records by IDs, and applying the passed field mask to the results.

      • readAllRecords

        protected abstract java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord> readAllRecords()
        Obtains an iterator for reading all records.

        Only active entities are returned.

        See Also:
        BulkStorageOperationsMixin.readAll()

      • readAllRecords

        protected abstract java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord> readAllRecords(com.google.protobuf.FieldMask fieldMask)
        Obtains an iterator for reading all records, and applying the passed field mask to the results.

        Only active entities are returned.

        See Also:
        BulkStorageOperationsMixin.readAll()

      • readAllRecords

        protected abstract java.util.Iterator<io.spine.server.entity.EntityRecord> readAllRecords(EntityQuery<I> query,
                                                                                          com.google.protobuf.FieldMask fieldMask)
        Obtains an iterator for reading records matching the query, and applying the passed field mask to the results.

        Returns only active entities if the query does not specify the lifecycle flags. In order to read inactive entities, the corresponding filters must be set to the provided query.

        See Also:
        RecordStorage.readAll(EntityQuery, FieldMask)
